text:
A Dreamy Reflection

A dim room, Raskolnikov lost in thought.  
His gaze drifts as memories surface.  
Raskolnikov: “I was in love once…”  
Mother: “Oh, yes, my dear.”  

---

A tender moment shared, glances exchanged.  
Raskolnikov: “She was sickly, always dreaming…”  
Dounia: “It was not just spring delirium.”  

---

Raskolnikov, distracted, kisses his mother.  
Pulcheria Alexandrovna: “You love her even now?”  
Raskolnikov: “Her? Oh, yes… but no…”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov reflects on a past love for a sickly girl, revealing his complex feelings and memories.
